DwdPlotter module

class DwdPlotter.PlotterForData(data_all, data_mean, index_for_plot, column_name_list, start_date_datetime, end_date_datetime, plot_name, k_factor, x_coordinate, y_coordinate, type_of_data, unit_dict, title_dict)[source]

Bases: object

Description

This class will create plots of the data of chosen stations.

__init__(data_all, data_mean, index_for_plot, column_name_list, start_date_datetime, end_date_datetime, plot_name, k_factor, x_coordinate, y_coordinate, type_of_data, unit_dict, title_dict)[source]
Parameters

  • data_all – as DataFrame. All the datas in a DataFrame.

  • data_mean – as DataFrame. Your calculation (average for example).

  • index_for_plot – as list. The timedelta for x-axes.

  • column_name_list – as list. Names of plotted lines.

  • start_date_datetime – as datetime. Your chosen start-date (YYYY-MM-DD-HH:MM).

  • end_date_datetime – as datetime. Your chosen end-date (YYYY-MM-DD-HH:MM).

  • plot_name – as string. Your chosen plot-title.

  • k_factor – as int. Your chosen k_factor.

  • x_coordinate – as float. Your chosen x-coordinate.

  • y_coordinate – as float. Your chosen y-coordinate.

  • type_of_data – as string. Check DwdDicht.py type_of_data_list

  • unit_dict – as string. Will get the correct type from self.type_of_data.

  • title_dict – as string. Will get the correct type from self.type_of_data.

plotting_compare(compare_station, data_to_compare, diff, maximum, avg_diff, type_of_method)[source]
Description

Will plot your data and the data with a station you are comparing with.

Parameters

  • compare_station – as string. The name of the station with the right prefix.

  • data_to_compare – as DataFrame. The real data of a station.

  • diff – as DataFrame. The difference between your calculation and real data of a station.

  • maximum – as int. Maximum difference.

  • avg_diff – as array. Average difference. (Will plot a constant line)

  • type_of_method – as string. Name of your calculation method.

Returns

“plot saved” if succeeded.

plotting_data(type_of_method)[source]
Description

Will plot your data.

Parameters

type_of_method – as string Name of your calculation method

Returns

“plot saved” if succeeded.

class DwdPlotter.PlotterForStations(x, y, z=0, type_of_data='')[source]

Bases: object

Description

This class will create plots of station locations

__init__(x, y, z=0, type_of_data='')[source]
Parameters

  • x – x-coordinates: as array.

  • y – y-coordinates: as array.

  • z – z-coordinates: as array.

  • type_of_data – as string. Check DwdDict.py type_of_data_list

plotting_3d(projection=False)[source]
Description

This method will plot all the stations in as a 3D-Version

Parameters

projection – as Boolean. If projection==True, it will project the height of the stations.

Returns

“plot saved” if succeeded.

plotting_height_2d()[source]
Description

This method will plot all the stations in as a 2D-Version

Returns

“plot saved” if succeeded.
